results.title: How much land does a man need?
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a Russian folk tale by Leo Tolstoy about a man who serves a greedy master - himself. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: How much is enough
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the United Nations Children’s Fund in Africa, the Near East, Pakistan, the Orient and the West Indies. It shows the scope and the type of work done by the organisation which raises money all over the world to help needy children in underdeveloped areas

results.title: How many stars
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division
results.brief_description: Discusses the solar system, the Milky Way and distant galaxies. Clarifies the meaning of the term “light year”. Includes a short history of the telescope.

results.title: How long is a minute?
results.brief_description: Divides the screen into five separate images to show visually a precise minute, without any reference to clocks or seconds. Reveals what can be done in less time and what takes longer.

results.title: How it happens
results.creator_credit: Ritter-Jepperson Studios and Victorian Road Safety Division
results.brief_description: The experiences of a small boy, injured in a road accident, are used to emphasise why children should obey the following safety rules: play where it is safe - not on the roadways; look both ways when crossing streets; never ride bicycles more than two abreast; never run out onto roads from behind stationary vehicles.

results.title: How it happened
results.brief_description: Shows common risks and dangers telephone linesmen face resulting generally from negligence of correct safety procedures on their part or that of their fellow workers. A series of sequences provide examples of accidents brought about by one or more of the following basic causes: thoughtlessness, short cuts, poor job planning and arrangement, negligence of safety rules and over-confidence.

results.title: How does a candle burn?
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the properties of candle wax change as the wax is transformed from a solid to a gaseous state and explores the nature and shape of the flame and the function of the wick.

results.title: How blood clots
results.brief_description: Shows what role each part of the blood playsin the clotting process. Follows the actual generation of platelets from large cells found in the bone marrow.

results.title: How's it going?
results.brief_description: The four cases that make up this film deal with an important management activity: the interview. They have been designed to permit investigation of basic interviewing principles and techniques for appraising employee performance. Specifically, they serve as a springboard for analysing four goals of both interviewer and interviewee: understanding, agreement, action and learning. Methods for dealing with interview problems. The four cases are: 1. More than paperwork. 2. Give and take. 3. Means to an end. 4. The way ahead.
